parameters.opinion_correct: Number of opinion statements classified correctly (out of 5).
parameters.fact_correct: Number of factual statements classified correctly (out of 5).

reference: Younger Americans are better than older Americans at telling factual news statements from opinions, Pew Research Center, October 23, 2018.
description:
Description
Pew Research Center conducted a survey in 2018, asking a sample of
U.S. adults to categorize five factual and five opinion statements.
This dataset provides data from this survey, with information on the age
group of the participant as well as the number of factual and opinion
statements they classified correctly (out of 5).
title: Can Americans categorize facts and opinions?
format: A data frame with 5,035 rows and 3 variables.
